comment.author: 64385607@N06
comment._content: I'm pretty sure this is the The Holy Cross Church at 2530 Church Avenue, Brooklyn NY 11226. maps.google.com/maps?q=2530+Church+Avenue,+Brooklyn+NY+11...

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: On June 22, 2011, TBoni suggested where this photo was taken; thank you for your efforts to #mapBK!

comment.author: 46011070@N05
comment._content: Yes, this is Holy Cross Church (the parish where I grew up) in Flatbush, but the image is flipped horizontally, as you can see in the images at the links below. A steeple was later added to the flat-top section... http://www.flickr.com/photos/brooklyn_museum/5832943285/ Here is an image of the church today. At some point before I was born (1954) the original brick was resurfaced... http://brooklyncatholic.blogspot.com/2010/06/holy-cross-flatbush.html Dates as to the establishment of the church conflict online, but it celebrated its 150th anniversary in 1998, referenced at the end of this article... http://articles.nydailynews.com/1998-05-27/local/18065154_1_two-more-fires-parishioners-bias-unit

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content:
Thanks, celeste. We'll check it out and correct. 
Deb Wythe
